intro: Kuhnia leptophylla var. mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican feather grass, is a perennial grass native to Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves that are often described as feathery or silky in texture. The plant typically grows in open, sunny environments such as rocky soils or disturbed areas. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikelets, typical of the Poaceae family. Its ornamental value comes from its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
